Notes:

1. As some ereader applications have certain abilities I have created various file types of this edition of Jane Eyre. 

The epub files with the audio can be played in ibooks on ipads, and Moonplus Reader for Android.

The mobi file, contains only the images, as the Kindle applications for various devices, and Mobipocket Reader for PC - at this point in time Ã¢â‚¬â€œ sadly, cannot play back the audio.

2. My decision to upload the book in three volumes as well was:

(1) the whole file was getting rather large and was worried about some ereader applicationsÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ ability to open the file up;

(2) for ease of sending in an email.

The deciding factor was discovering, in my research about the book and its various editions, that it originally came out as three hard bound volumes, so I split the digital file into three parts so that it reflected the original hard copies.

3. The images and audio tracks, inserted in the ebooks, are from the 11 part 1983 BBC television mini-series, starring Timothy Dalton and Zelah Clarke, off of a privately owned DVD.

4. Reference material is of a scanned edition, in pdf format, from the University of St. MichaelÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s College, Toronto Library, date stamped 1890, published by W. Nicholson & Sons, Limited (included with this upload, which I used when altering an existing American 2010 digital copy (also contained in upload).
